intro: Boerhavia paniculata, commonly known as redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a low-growing annual herb that typically reaches heights of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, fleshy leaves that are often reddish in color. Its flowers are small, clustered in paniculate inflorescences, and are usually pink or red in hue. Boerhavia paniculata thrives in arid or sandy soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields.
